title: How Does the Naivedya Become Prasadam? | Sri Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.text: When you go in front of the Lord, the Lord is watching us, He is hearing our prayers,
He is accepting our Naivedya, He is giving back Prasad and He is blessing the devotees.
All interactions are going. This interaction means love. Love means there should be give
and take. If you want to develop love with anybody, there should be give and take. Now
we want to love the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Now you have to give and He gives
and you should take. So now the devotees want to give some food. So Krishna says, Asana
me, I will accept. With devotion, if somebody offers some Naivedya, Krishna says, I accept.
In this class, they may say, the plate came out as it is. God has not eaten anything.
Their idea is that eating means God will eat the way I eat. We eat, we complete the whole
plate. But God's eating is not that. His eating is very fine. It is said that even if the
Lord glances on the food, that turns into Prasadam. And on that Prasadam we eat. Remembering
